What does the value of K represent in the KNN algorithm?

answers.a: The number of features in the dataset.
answers.b: The distance metric used to calculate similarities.

question: In the KNN algorithm, how is the class of a new instance determined?

answers.a: By taking the weighted average of the classes of its k nearest neighbors.
answers.b: By selecting the class of the nearest neighbor with the highest confidence score.
answers.c: By choosing the class of the majority of its k nearest neighbors.
answers.d: By fitting a decision boundary using logistic regression.

question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of the KNN algorithm?

answers.a: It is not suitable for multi-class classification.
answers.b: It requires a significant amount of memory to store the entire training dataset.
answers.c: It assumes that the data instances are linearly separable.
answers.d: It is sensitive to the feature scaling of the input data.

question: Which of the following statements about the decision boundary in K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) algorithm is true?

answers.a: The decision boundary in KNN is always linear.
answers.b: The decision boundary in KNN can be non-linear.
answers.c: The decision boundary in KNN depends only on the value of K.
